abstract.text: Configure your app and website to enable people to install your app on their devices from your website.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

metadata.title: Distributing your app from your website

inlineContent.text: In eligible regions, you can distribute approved, non-marketplace apps from your website. To distribute your app, fill out a webform that outlines the qualifications, and if approved, Apple enables you to download a framework that facilitates the secure installation of your app from your website.

Coordinate with App Store Connect by providing your web domain and a public key that the system uses to validate your app’s installations. When you submit your app and pass review, App Store Connect enables you to access your approved app’s alternative distribution package. For more information, see

Deploy a web server and modify your website to link to your app, which you host on your server. To prepare your app for installation, download and assemble a complete alternative distribution package using the ID that App Store Connect provides; see

. Add a Download button on your webpage that links to the alternative distribution package. The URL you assign the button uses a custom scheme that browsers handle differently, instructing them to provide the system with your app’s alternative distribution pacakge for installation on the device.

Alternative app marketplaces are available in Xcode 15.3, iOS 17.4 and later, and iPadOS 18.0 and later. To enable web distribution of other apps, use Xcode 15.4 or later, iOS 17.5 or later, and iPadOS 18.0 or later. For more information, see

content.text: Request approval to distribute your app

inlineContent.text: Each app follows the same process for alternative distribution over the web and is subject to Apple’s approval, however the approval process varies by app type.
For marketplace apps, see
. For other apps, see
. In either case, you sign the
to the
The signed addendum prompts App Store Connect to provide an
alternative distribution package
for your app in App Store Connect. You host this alternative distribution package on your website and use it to install your app on devices.

content.text: Set up your app for alternative distribution

inlineContent.text: Distributing your app on the web requires one-time setup with App Store Connect. First, define the domain where you distribute the app by calling the
endpoint:
For more information about the request’s parameters, see
Then, supply a public key that App Store Connect uses to verify installation requests for your app by calling the
endpoint:
For steps to create your distribution key, see

If you’re developing an alternative marketplace app, create one distribution key pair and reuse it across all your developer relationships and apps that install from your marketplace. Otherwise, create a distribution key pair for each app that you distribute from your website.
For more information about setting up a marketplace app in App Store Connect, see

content.text: Submit your app and host it on your web server

inlineContent.text: When you’re ready to distribute your app, submit it to App Store Connect for review. Choose the review type:
A web-distributed binary that you also intend to release on marketplace apps, including the App Store.
App Store
A marketplace app or other app that won’t also reside on the App Store; see
If Apple approves your app for distribution, download your app’s
alternative distribution package
from App Store Connect, this package contains everything that the system needs to install your app. For more information, see
Assemble and host the alternative distribution package on your web server in a location accessible to the device; see
. When you want to update your app, submit it to App Store Connect and repeat the process.

content.text: Add a Download button on your webpage

inlineContent.text: People download your app by tapping a button on your webpage with a URL scheme reserved for app installations. The browser forwards the installation request to the system, which retrieves the right app variant or delta from the alternative distribution package for the app that you host on your server.
The button URL is of the
format, which provides the system with everything it needs to install the app:
The URL parameters are:
URL parameter
Description
Your app’s alternative distribution package. This value has unique domain-matching requirements; for more information, see
A required JSON web signature (JWS). For more information, see

An optional authentication token to include if downloads require authorization. The device sends the token back to your token endpoint to reference this request. The value is free-form, and can contain any information at your discretion, such as a customer identifier.
An optional user ID for the page visitor. The system groups apps in restore requests based on
. The system also provides the
as
in the call to your authorization endpoint during re-authentication; for more information, see

An optional URL to a product landing page for the app on your marketplace website. The operating system populates the value in the Share Sheet when a person touches and holds the app’s icon on the Home Screen.
The system enforces the following criteria for a webpage that invokes an app download request:

Your webpage initiates app installation only on a person’s express invocation; in other words, no automatic or indirect app installation. Your webpage can only install an app when a person requests it by tapping a button.

The origin of the main frame on the webpage containing the installation link must match the domain passed to App Store Connect. The browser app records this information and sends it to MarketplaceKit as covered in

Some apps that Apple approves for web distribution can also install from the App Store or an alternative app marketplace. You can customize the user experience depending on the source from which a person downloads your app. For more information, see

content.text: Coordinate with the device from your web server

inlineContent.text: When a page visitor taps the install button, the system communicates with your web server to validate the request and retrieve the data necessary to perform the installation. If you supply an authentication token in the installation request URL, the system checks if your authentication server authorizes the download. Then system then requests an app license from your server followed by the app itself. For more information, see
Your app can install over the web only after passing
. To test your app beforehand, set the installation source for development builds. Setting the installation source enables you to simulate a web distribution in production.
Set your target’s Alternative Distribution - Web build setting to
The build setting is
. Open your Xcode project in Xcode 15.4 or later and add the setting manually if it isn’t present.
This build setting overrides the
property for development builds to return

, which enables you to test any custom code branching your app might do, such as displaying a different image or offering different menu items depending on whether your app installs from the web or a marketplace.
In your scheme’s Run task Options tab, Distribution selection menu, choose Website to simulate installation over the web for runs on device through Xcode.
Similarly, to return
for the
distributor in a test plan, choose Website in the Distribution selection menu of your test plan’s configuration.

distributing-your-app-from-your-website-.alt: Three screenshots of iPhone that show the stages of installing a fictional alternative app, Camping App from the developer’s website. The left screenshot has the caption App website and shows the app icon for Camping App, which is a representation of a location, below that is the app title Camping App, below that are lines that represent descriptive text, and below that is the button Install Camping App. The center screenshot has the caption Install sheet and shows a confirmation, the title of the sheet is taplandinc.com Would Like to Install an App, followed by lines that represent descriptive text, followed by the Camping App app info, which includes the developer name Tapland, Inc. as well as screenshots, below the app info is the Install Camping App button, followed by the Cancel button. The right screenshot has the caption Installed app and shows a representation of the homescreen with Camping App installed.
A diagram that illustrates building and deploying your app one time allows you to distribute from three different places, an alterative marketplace app, an app webpage, and an app web server.
A screenshot of and example download button, a button with the label Install Megabyte Mart.

A screenshot of Xcode with the project AltDistTesting selected in the project navigation sidebar, and the build settings tab open. Under targets, AltDistTesting Tests is selected, under Deployment the setting Alternative Distribution - Web is set to Yes.
A screenshot of Xcode Scheme settings window with Run selected in the sidebar and the options tab open. The Distribution pop-up menu shows the Website option selected.
A screenshot of Xcode with TestPlan selected in the project navigation sidebar and the Configurations tab open. The Distribution pop-up menu has Website selected.

abstract.text: Create an alternative app marketplace, distribute your app on an alternative app marketplace, or distribute your app from your website.
The source from which the app installs.
A URI scheme that defines an alternative distribution app installation link.
Enable the distribution of other third-party apps from within your marketplace app.
Design your app for alternative distribution from an alternative app marketplace.

Customize your app depending on the installation source
